alert.note: Alert for Denali (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 05 at 6:09AM AKDT until July 06 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNINGS IN EFFECT FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 220, 221, 222, 223, 224, 225 AND 226... A thermal low pressure trough that extends from Northway to Anaktuvuk Pass will move to Northway to Arctic Village this afternoon and remain there through Wednesday, before spreading slowly west on Thursday. This trough combined with a warm and unstable airmass will cause isolated thunderstorms to continue over the Eastern Interior through Thursday. Areas south of Ft Yukon can expect scattered thunderstorms with gusty winds, hail, and frequent lightning in the afternoon and evening today and Wednesday. Expect 3000-5000 lightning strokes today with most of them from Ft Yukon south to the Alaska Range. Wednesday should see similar conditions. Min RH should be 25-40% across the Eastern Interior today, with the driest conditions along the Alaska Highway. The Eastern Interior should remain warmer than normal and relatively dry from Wednesday through the end of the week. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKDT TONIGHT FOR LIGHTNING FOR DENALI... * AFFECTED AREA...North of the Denali Park Road. * TIMING...Until Midnight Tuesday night. * LIGHTNING ACTIVITY LEVEL...4. * WINDS...North 5 to 10 mph. * HUMIDITY...As low as 44 percent. * TEMPERATURES...70 to 74. * IMPACTS...Ample lightning could lead to numerous new fire starts.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that conditions are occurring or will occur which could lead to the development of large and dangerous fires. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them, to the public. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
